query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Inception Paper
result.description: The Inception Paper will set out the terms of reference on the investigation in the WP. It will look at the respective competences and activities of EU and member states’ involvement in using science, cultural and innovation diplomacy to foster regional and inter-regional processes in the global South to date.

project.title: European Leadership in Cultural, Science and Innovation Diplomacy

programme.title: SOCIETAL CHALLENGES - Europe In A Changing World - Inclusive, Innovative And Reflective Societies

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Special Issue on EU CSD in the South
result.description: A final Special Issue will be produced, which will bring together the various contributions of WP5. It will constitute a collection of cultural, science and innovation diplomacy approaches, practices and activities at the regional and inter-regional level, from the perspective of the EU, its Member States and major EU competitors in this domain.

result.title: Series of Policy Papers
result.description: Results of the survey for Task 3 will be published in a series of policy papers immediately and driven by policy, containing recommendations addressed to the EEAS and the Commission on how to approach scientists, military, policy makers and civil society in the MENA region, Kazakhstan and Turkey. The Survey for Task 4 will be treated similarly but with a focus on the foreign media reporting the EU’s activities in the domains of science and innovation policy. Each Policy Brief will target an appropriate policy community in Brussels and the member states and appropriate stakeholders in countries outside the EU engaged in the project.

result.title: Second Training Workshop on Diplomacy for Science and Culture
result.description: Training Workshops on Diplomacy for Science and Culture: Two training workshops on Cultural and Science Diplomacy will be organised and hosted by the VUB’s European Centre for Global Diplomacy. They will provide an excellent training environment for researchers and students and for all those engaged in science, innovation and cultural diplomacy.

result.title: Comprehensive research report
result.description: The report generalizes the insights at the country level and explains variations between different traffic safety cultures. It establishes an empirically saturated model of traffic safety culture and gives an overview of cultural forms and types. It is based on comparisons between national cultures, but also between different cultures within one country and cultures of similar topographical and infrastructural conditions between countries.

project.title: Traffic Safety Cultures and the Safe Systems Approach – Towards a Cultural Change Research and Innovation Agenda for Road Safety

result.title: Country reports
result.description: Country reports are based on national case study and give a summary of the variation and unity of a traffic safety culture within a socio-political unit. They are standardised with reference to the theoretical framework which allows comparative analysis in the next step.

project.title: Traffic Safety Cultures and the Safe Systems Approach – Towards a Cultural Change Research and Innovation Agenda for Road Safety

result.title: Comprehensive research report for different countries
result.description: National reports go into the details of the implicit cultural patterns at the country level and below in order to show how culture interacts with the other components of the model and which mechanisms can be established in order to improve a specific traffic safety culture.

result.title: Final report and manual Conference
result.description: The final report will include all elements mentioned above and can be used as a state of the art handbook of traffic safety culture and change management in Europe. The conference will bring together stakeholders, practitioners, and researchers in will be a first step in establishing a cultural perspectives within the safe systems approach.

result.title: evaGuide Standardization Report
result.description: Contribute to the development of pre-normative standards that can be included in later regulatory provisions by operational stakeholders. In this way embed the evaGuide innovative features within the European standardization landscape in the secure technologies field. Monitor the works of ISO/TC 391 Technical Committee (Societal & Citizen Security) especially with regard to Systems Interoperability; alternatively, participate in the works of a relevant CEN Workshop Agreement.

result.title: Final ENP Report
result.description: This deliverable will summarize the work completed, the procedures undertaken by WP4, the learning outcomes from the regionalisation process and the overall outcomes of the efforts. The report will contain specific recommendations for diverse stakeholders in order to encourage the development of national courses.

result.title: Report on user & functional requirement of patient education and engagement portal.
result.description: Report on user & functional requirement of patient education and engagement portal: description of the results of brainstorming sessions with project members and a focus group comprising individuals from different userclasses of the portal that will be developed, and how these were translated into the user & functional requirements that will be used to advertise a tender for the development of the technical platform for the portal by a subcontractor. Details of the compliance, procedures, and/or declaration and data management plan will form part of deliverable 3.1 where the functionality of the system is described
